explanation:
Agent A is correct. The statements (void) cls; (void) connection; and (void) toe; are expression-statements that have no side effects; their removal would not change program behaviour, so they constitute dead code under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. These statements are executed but are no-ops, so they meet the rule’s definition of dead code. 

Remediations include removing those no-op casts and either (a) omitting the names of the unused parameters in the function definition (e.g. use unnamed parameters or comments in the parameter list), or (b) using a single, documented mechanism to indicate unused parameters that is acceptable to your project (for example a compiler-specific unused-attribute or a standardized macro that expands appropriately for the toolchain). Any chosen fix should avoid leaving executed no-op statements in the code base.
